name: Park Plaza Victoria Amsterdam

reviews.text: I picked this as it was advertised as easy to get to from the airport. I took the train and not knowing where the hotel was, walked out to the taxi stand to ask them. The taxi driver pointed across the parking lot and sure enough, there was the hotel. The entire area has beautiful architecture. I wish I had time to explore. Because I had an early morning flight, the train was not an option to the airport so it really wasn't the best location for me but the hotel organized a taxi with a fare of 47 euros. He did an excellent job of conveying me there. The people at the hotel were friendly. My room, however, was a long way from the lobby. The bedding was comfortable and the room was quiet. I met other people in the elevator that reported being frequent visitors. I found the staff to be very helpful.
reviews.title: Convenient if you are visiting Amsterdam but not luxurious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amsterdam is a wonderful place to spend a few days. When you arrive from the airport to downtown in 30 minutes for 3,90 euros and you see your hotel from the exit of the Station is even better!
reviews.title: 200 m from the Central Station

reviews.text: The location is excellent, with many options to eat e walk around. The Hotel is comfortable and informal at the same time. Breakfast has options for all tastes and has an espresso machine. There is no noise coming from outside, but I had a few noisy room neighbours.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room I was placed in was in real need of a spruce up. Bit of paint, new carpet, even a clean to be honest.
reviews.title: Great Value
Website showed great potential. Reality is "old worn hotel"
reviews.text: The bathroom floor was pretty dirty, so I cleaned that myself before I had a shower. The shower was also pretty dirty, and the sink didn't drain properly, so after I had a shave the sink looked awful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for one night whilst in Amsterdam.
reviews.title: Wonderful Central Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is situated in a fantastic location; being opposite the main railway station and in walking distance from many of the museums, restaurants and sites. It is also opposite the canal cruise boat area and the tram station for further access and tours around the city.
reviews.title: central location

reviews.text: We found the hotel staff to be very helpful, friendly and able to direct any queries we had with regards to directions.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay but bad customer service

reviews.text: The room we stayed in was a junior suite and was wonderful. The room was very large with a bed to match and had views over the canal towards the station. Facilities in the room included a coffee machine, free bottled water, dressing gown and slippers as well as the usual toiletries, hair dryer and iron. The bed was extremely comfortable and no noise could be heard from outside or other rooms.
reviews.title: Good location, solid service, fine hotel
Home from Home
reviews.text: Overall an excellent hotel to stay in during a visit to Amsterdam
We stayed in the one of the executive suites. The room was comfortable and clean with a good view (and little noise) looking over toe=wards the station. Very handy for almost all trams.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: Breakfast was included and good quality and choice.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.text: Spa very quiet when we went and all the better for that!
reviews.title: Good location for access to Centraal Station

reviews.text: Staff helpful in booking restaurant (sourced on TripAdvisor of course!)
reviews.title: Location is one of the best

reviews.text: This hotel is in a perfect location. Directly opposite the central railway station and directly around the corner from where all of the tour buses leave from is also directly opposite all the canal cruises. Hotel was very comfortable, clean and tidy and had plenty of room for three adults in one room. Internet access was easily accessible. Nearby a multiple selection of restaurants and a supermarket. Overall a very nice hotel to stay at and I can highly recommend.
reviews.title: Nice and quiet in urban wing

reviews.text: Don't remamber last time I stayed what thought was 4star hotel where the bed was lumpy with more lumpy pillows and douvet ! Dark old carpets and room that looked like something out of an dingy old pub ! The cleaners did not even take away dirty glasses. The only positive comment is that the concierge was very helpfull .
reviews.title: Needing serious refurbishment

reviews.text: An old hotel, seemingly extended over the years, so a somewhat frustrating labyrinth layout. Rooms been updated more recently with a quirky design that could suit those on romantic trips as well as business. The bathroom can be either open or closed plan - with frosted glass shower and toilet doors. Don't choose the hotel if you want to wake up with a view of the city or a quaint courtyard - the view from my room was ugly. Location is A1 for the station (easy, quick and cheap access to airport as well as onward to other rail locations), central city highlights and further away sights (via central tram access at the main station). Did not try the food nor the spa, and it does frustrate me a little that none of these other potential distinguishing features are highlighted by check-in staff. The spa looked like it was not dedicated to the hotel, but was a separate business itself, so I don't know how busy it would be in any case.
reviews.title: Great room without a view

reviews.text: Booked a superior room online, cheapest price of €230/room for 2 persons b&b. Arrived early and although room not available I was told I'd been given an upgrade as I was a Carlson Club cardholder member - fabulous! However, when I came back later, was informed by another member of staff that my 'upgrade' was going to cost me another €30+ on top? I queried and was informed that a trainee had checked me in and shouldn't have given me the upgrade as "all you have is a red loyalty card " (I'm guessing 1 up from nothing)!! Arguing the toss did nothing & I didn't want to embarrass myself in front of my partner so I declined the upgrade on fairness grounds (or rather lack of fairness!).
reviews.title: Poor attitude to customers!

reviews.text: Had an 'urban' room which was tiny, overlooking a noisy side street. Clean, & reasonably comfortable bed. Good selection of tv channels.
reviews.title: Location, comfort & value

reviews.text: Breakfast was ok-ish. Not really a 'full English', but 'continental' was well catered for.
reviews.title: Great, central location

description: Restyled! The historic Park Plaza Victoria Amsterdam offers 306 modern superior rooms, executive rooms and suites. The 164 new urban style rooms were completely restyled early 2011 and have a sleek, trendy and fashionable design. All rooms offer excellent facilities as you would expect from a four-star hotel in downtown Amsterdam. 306 rooms including 164 in new Urban Wing, 10 meeting rooms up to 150 persons, Boardroom and private dining possible, Restaurant, bar, brasserie with terrace, Directly opposite Central Station and parking, Fitness and swimming pool, WiFi (high speed).
